abstract.text: The fundamental storage mechanism of TextKit that contains the text managed by the system.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: that adds behavior for managing a set of client
objects. A text storage object notifies its layout managers of changes to its characters or attributes, which lets the layout managers redisplay the text as needed.
You can access a text storage object from any thread of your app, but your app must guarantee access from only one thread at a time.
In macOS, this class also defines properties for getting and setting scriptable attributes of
objects. Unless you’re dealing with scriptability, you shouldn’t access these properties directly. In particular, using the
properties is an inefficient way to manipulate the text storage, since accessing these properties involves the creation of many objects. Instead, use the text access methods defined by
class implements change management through the

methods, as well as verification of attributes, delegate handling, and layout management notification. The one aspect it doesn’t implement is managing the actual attributed string storage, which subclasses manage by overriding the two
These primitives should perform the change, then call
to let the parent class know there are changes.

abstract.text: The text storage contents as an array of attribute runs.
The text storage contents as an array of characters.
The font for the text storage.
The color for the text.
The text storage contents as an array of paragraphs.
The text storage contents as an array of words.
** Deprecations ***
A string of text that manages data, layout, and stylistic information for ranges of characters to support rendering.
The character contents of the attributed string as a string.
Returns the attributes for the character at the specified index.
A mutable string with associated attributes (such as visual style, hyperlinks, or accessibility data) for portions of its text.
Begins the buffering of changes to the string’s characters and attributes.
Sets the attributes for the characters in the specified range to the specified attributes.
Ends the buffering of changes to the string’s characters and attributes.
Replaces the characters in the given range with the characters of the given string.
A dynamic plain-text Unicode string object, for use instead of a  variable in cases that require reference semantics.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
The fundamental storage mechanism of TextKit that contains the text managed by the system.
Constants that indicate the types of changes.
Adds a layout manager to the text storage object’s set of layout managers.
The difference between the current length of the edited range and its length before editing.
The delegate for the text storage object.
A notification that posts after a text storage finishes processing edits.
Tracks changes made to the text storage object, allowing the text storage to record the full extent of changes.
A mask that describes the kinds of edits pending for the text storage object.
The range of text that contains changes.
Ensures that attribute fixing occurs in the specified range.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the text storage object fixes attributes lazily.
Invalidates attributes in the specified range.
The layout managers for the text storage object.
Cleans up changes to the text storage object and notifies its delegate and layout managers of changes.
Removes a layout manager from the text storage object’s set of layout managers.
The observer for the text storage object.
A notification that posts before a text storage begins processing edits.
The optional methods that delegates of text storage objects implement to handle text-edit processing.
Optional methods that delegates implement to handle editing and transaction processing.
A mutable string with associated attributes (such as visual style, hyperlinks, or accessibility data) for portions of its text.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to create an instance of the class.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to retrieve data from an instance of the class.
A protocol that mutable objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
A dynamic plain-text Unicode string object.
